did.abstract: The Albany General Store Records contain business records kept by an unidentified proprietor of a general store which sold dry goods, rum, and other merchandise.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Albany General Store was run by an unidentified proprietor of a general store, probably located in Albany, which sold dry goods, rum, and other merchandise to customers from Albany to Schaghitcoke, (north of Troy, New York), and westward to Stone Arabia, and other Mohawk Valley settlements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the business records of the general store including the names of early Albany Dutch settlers. The volume also features day book entries from Oneida, New York, 1877-78, and notes on English grammar and physical geography taken by a student at the Oswego Normal School, 1878.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Albany General Store Records, 1784-1786. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Albany General Store Records).
